channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Highlights from the VMAs, from Mariah Carey's first win to Lady Gaga's magic act
item.description: Sunday's VMAs were the first time the awards show has been broadcast on CBS in addition to MTV. The show recognized rising stars and longtime icons al...

item.title: DHS launches immigration crackdowns in Chicago, Boston
item.description: These announcements by DHS are just the latest escalation of federal action in U.S. cities like Los Angeles and Washington, D.C. — all led by Democrat...

item.title: This is what could happen to a child who doesn't get vaccinated
item.description: An estimated 14 million kids don't get any vaccines. They face serious threats from measles, diarrhea, pneumonia and more.

item.title: France's government collapses after the prime minister loses a confidence vote
item.description: Legislators toppled France's government in a confidence vote, a new crisis for Europe's second-largest economy. Prime Minister François Bayrou was ous...

item.title: After 6 years, Hollow Knight Silksong is here at last — and it was worth the wait

item.title: Hamas discussing US 'ideas' for Gaza ceasefire after Trump's 'last warning'
item.description: Hamas says it received "some ideas" from the US through mediators on how to reach a Gaza ceasefire deal.

item.title: House panel releases birthday message to Jeffrey Epstein allegedly written by Trump
item.description: President Trump has denied penning the message, which includes the outline of a woman's body.

item.title: Supreme Court rules that immigration raids in LA can continue
item.description: US top court says that immigration agents can stop people based solely on their race, language or job.

item.title: Why has the French PM had to go and what happens next?
item.description: France's prime minister has lost a confidence vote, sending parliament into another period of chaos and uncertainty.

item.title: Newly released video shows fatal stabbing of Ukrainian refugee riding Charlotte light rail

item.title: Democrats in Congress release alleged Trump birthday note to Epstein
item.description: The White House says the president did not draw the picture or sign the note, after it was published on Monday.

item.title: Jury selection begins in the trial of the man accused of attempting to assassinate Trump in Florida

item.description: Ryan Routh, 59, has pleaded not guilty to charges of attempting to assassinate Mr. Trump during the presidential campaign and will be representing him...

item.title: Will a high-yield savings account be worth it after a September Fed rate cut?
item.description: A looming September Fed rate cut shouldn't discourage prospective high-yield savings account holders. Here's why.

item.title: France in fresh political crisis after MPs oust prime minister
item.description: The French government loses a vote of confidence and PM François Bayrou will resign on Tuesday.
